intro: Sarcolaena delphinensis, commonly known as the bluebells of the genus Sarcolaena, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, blue to violet flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds.
